answers.answer: Ask your Dr about MS, Fibromyalgia and Chronic Fatigue. Switch Drs if no-one believes your symptoms. Demand results.Good luck and God Bless!

Hi lenna..the pins and needles could be caused by your diabetes...have you asked your dr. about it..muscle weakness and pain, im not sure...sounds like it could be related to your cfs or fibromyalgia.If it was a brain tumor, you'd be having worse problems..and ms-dont start reading about it on the internet. It can make you crazy!Just start with your dr. you go to see for your other problems ans then go frm there....it could be nothing.
It is probably Diabetic Neuropathy. In can happen in places other than your feet. Besides controlling your diabetes to help the neuropathy, you can ask about a drug called Neurontin.
classic diabetic neuropathy. This is very common, you are not alone
don't know if anyone heard about the side effects from neurontin, can cause thoughts of suicide?  be careful!when taken on regular basis.

question: i am 34 year old woman diabetic,high bloodpressure. i have been having muscle weekness and pain in both arms and leggs. and also pins and needle feelings in my hands and feet.sometimes i get sick to my stomache.my main concern is could this be MS or a brain tumor? please help me to find out things that i need to ask so that maybe i will get something done.
title: mucle pain and weekness.
